Title: Business Intelligence Developer | Power Platform (Remote)
Job_Description:
WESCO is seeking a Business Intelligence Developer focused in Power Platform and design. In this role, you will report to the Business Intelligence Manager who is responsible for tools and technology supporting the company’s profitability initiative. You will be responsible for creating Power BI reporting and design, PowerApps applications, SQL table design, automation tooling, and possibly machine learning models.
Responsibilities:
Develop and maintain PowerApps for the business
Develop and maintain new and existing Power BI reporting
Work with SQL databases to create new tables and views, along with querying existing data

Title: Business Intelligence Developer | Power Platform (Remote)
Job_Description:
As a Senior AEM React Front End Developer you will be the Adobe AEM CMS lead. You will be responsible for executing, driving, and owning assignments through all stages of the development lifecycle to completion. You will function as the technical expert on complex applications, work assignments, and business problems. The ideal candidate has a proven and deep understanding of React and AEM web development engineering principles with respect to responsive web engineering, as well as the ability to provide guidance to developers within her/his scrum team towards the development of guest-facing experiences.
Responsibilities:
Participate in the implementation of Adobe Experience Manager, including design, definition and development of AEM/React content type models, workflows, templates, and components, and permissions.

Title: Business Intelligence Developer | Power Platform (Remote)
Job_Description:
WESCO Global Intelligent Automation COE is looking for an experienced UiPath developer to implement the automation pipeline. As Senior Developer, you will own and perform end to end development from solution design to implementation, user acceptance, and production monitoring. You will also be guiding and assisting citizen developers with design and/or implementation of the more challenging parts of their automations. Additionally, you will be responsible for executing, driving, and owning assignments through all stages of the development lifecycle to completion.
Responsibilities
Works directly with SME, as well as with project managers, and business analysts to translate business requirements and technical specifications to actual automations.
Maintains a culture of open communication, collaboration, mutual respect and productive behaviors.

Title: Business Intelligence Developer | Power Platform (Remote)
Job_Description:
As a Senior Architect - Solutions you will be responsible for gathering business requirements and designing the system per business needs. You will work with Business leaders and IT teams to come up with best optimal solution in a particular domain while ensuring the impact on other business domains. You key activities include developing business cases, conducts analysis and recommends effective solutions to meet functional, technical and meeting business needs.
Responsibilities:
Responsible for assisting in the establishment of an IT Architecture practice, and the adoption of an architecture and standards methodology.
Manages activities that take place during solution ideation, solution design, and solution implementation.
Conduct Well architect reviews and create physical deployment architecture recommendations for workloads.

Title: Senior Developer (Remote)
Job_Description:
As a Senior AEM React Front End Developer you will be the Adobe AEM CMS lead. You will be responsible for executing, driving, and owning assignments through all stages of the development lifecycle to completion. You will function as the technical expert on complex applications, work assignments, and business problems. The ideal candidate has a proven and deep understanding of React and AEM web development engineering principles with respect to responsive web engineering, as well as the ability to provide guidance to developers within her/his scrum team towards the development of guest-facing experiences.

Participate in the implementation of Adobe Experience Manager, including design, definition and development of AEM/React content type models, workflows, templates, and components, and permissions.

Title: Project Manager I (6497)
Job_Description:
We are seeking a Project Manager I. In this role, you will manage and oversee all aspects of a project to ensure it is completed on-time and within budget. You will have overall responsibility for managing scope, cost, schedule, internal staffing and outside vendors. You will prepare reports for upper management regarding status of project. You will work on projects/matters of limited complexity in a support role. Your work is closely managed.
*Responsibilities: *
*
Provides support with project development from beginning to end
Assists in defining project scope, goals and deliverables to support business goals in collaboration with senior management and stakeholders
Assists in developing full-scale project plans and associated communications documents

Title: Project Manager I (6497)
Job_Description:
As a Project Manager II, you will manage and oversee all aspects of a project to ensure it is completed on-time and within budget. You will have overall responsibility for managing scope, cost, schedule, internal staffing and outside vendors. While preparing reports for upper management regarding status of project. You will gain exposure to some of the complex tasks within the job function while occasionally directed in several aspects of the work.
Responsibilities
Directs and manages project development from beginning to end.
Defines project scope, goals and deliverables to support business goals in collaboration with senior management and stakeholders.
Develops full-scale project plans and associated communications documents.
Communicates project expectations to team members and stakeholders.

Title: Analyst - Credit and Collections (Remote)
Job_Description:
We are seeking a Credit and Collections Analyst. In this role, you will be responsible for, working under direct supervision, collects and maintains basic credit information. You will assist in review and verification of overdue accounts. You will contact costumers to confirm outstanding payments and renews credit information to help minimize outstanding debts.
Responsibilities:
Monitors past due invoices and make a high-volume of collections contacts via phone, e-mail, or customer portals.
Works with the customer to determine root cause of dispute for unpaid or short-paid invoices. Identifies and documents detailed reason.
Performs customer account reconciliations, including research of unapplied cash, and credits and unearned discounts.

Title: Analyst - Credit and Collections (Remote)
Job_Description:
The Sr. Manager, Strategic Contracts is responsible for managing sourcing and pricing responses to contract bid opportunities: reviewing incoming bids with the Bid Management team, assigning value and strategy, distributing items and packages to be sourced and priced by their team members, ensuring that packages are priced competitively and reviewed for completeness before delivery to the customer.
The Sr. Manager, Strategic Contracts will lead and develop effective strategies and tools in support of incoming customer requests. Collaboration with Bid Management, Sales, Procurement, Quality, Finance, and Operations is an essential aspect of the job.
The Sr. Manager, Strategic Contracts will review incoming business opportunities and provide sourcing and pricing support in response. Through their team, the Manager, Strategic Contracts will provide pricing information based on current and projected market dynamics, market opportunities, knowledge of in-stock inventory costs, industry supplier pricing trends and structures, and the use of internal analysis applications and tools. Upon request, the Manager, Strategic Contracts may perform research to validate sales quotations for accuracy and sustainability of profits throughout the life of the contract and will assist in all areas of the department. Ultimately responsible for the timeliness, completeness, quality and attractiveness of the sourcing and pricing completed by their team and submitted to Bid Management.

Title: Analyst - Credit and Collections (Remote)
Job_Description:
We are seeking a Senior Analyst - HRIS. In this role, you will process and analyze employee information by using Human Resources Information Systems (HRIS). You will design, implement, and analyzes reports to determine the overall trends of the organization. You will ensure systems integration and upgrades by collaborating and communicating with other colleagues.
Responsibilities:
Acts as liaison between business, human resources director and process owners, and 3rd party development vendor for all HRIS system?s needs.
Mentors business representatives through software development lifecycle and supports new functionality and process improvement initiatives.
Provides technical, operations, and training support to users of HRIS through documentation processes, and delivers end user training in an understandable context for all levels of users, and communicates changes to business requirements or enhancements or production issues to IT, payroll, human resources and other affected parties.

Title: Analyst - Credit and Collections (Remote)
Job_Description:
As a Lead Analyst, for Credit and Collections, you will be responsible for the activities and operations in the credit and collections department. You will oversee the processing and verification of applications for credit and the solicitation for payment on overdue accounts. You will investigate credit issues and suggest payment options to be approved.
Responsibilities:
Monitors past due invoices and makes collections contacts via phone, e-mail, or customer portals.
Evaluates collectability of unearned cash discounts, finance charges, small dollar invoices, etc. and performs and approves write-offs of uncollectable amounts within their level of authority.
Participates in and/or leads monthly accounts receivable aging and dispute reviews with financial services team and branch personnel. Documents and pursue follow-up actions agreed to during meetings.

Title: Analyst - Credit and Collections (Remote)
Job_Description:
As a Senior Analyst - IT Security, you will be responsible for delivering second-level operational and technical support for security solutions related to firewalls, encryption, intrusion detection systems, vulnerability scanning, security monitoring tools, authentication, identity management and access control systems. You will execute threat management, vulnerability management, and breach management processes to prevent, detect, respond to, and recover from security incidents.
Responsibilities:
Collaborates on critical IT projects to ensure security issues are addressed throughout project life cycle.
Monitors computer data network system, including LAN and WAN, firewall and anti-spam data security infrastructure and recommends mitigation actions.

Title: Senior Engineer - Application
Job_Description:
We are seeking a Senior Application Engineer. In this role, you will support and promote Industrial automation products, systems, and services requiring technical knowledge of engineering and cost effectiveness. You will maintain all certifications, required by automation vendors, for authorization to have access to their automation products. You will train the Wesco sales force on automation products.
Responsibilities:
Maintains expertise in industrial automation products; acts as domain expert internally and externally.
Attains, and maintains, all vendor required certifications for those automation products represented.
First line of pre/post automation sales support for sales teams and customers.

Title: Director - Data Science
Job_Description:
As the Director - Data Science, you will direct activities related to the strategy, design, development, and implementation of Data Science, Artificial Intelligence (AI) and Machine Learning (ML) deliveries for enterprise application functions. You will frequently interact with C-Level leaders, lead and create new Machine Learning Operations (MLOPs) and data science capabilities. You will manage multiple Data Scientist teams, supporting different products or lines of businesses to build innovations around AI.
Responsibilities:
Create strategies and objectives for the sub-function and develop budgets, policies, and procedures to support the organization
Direct and guide managers, and review different AI/ML modelling requests, timeline, and cost

Title: Director - Data Science
Job_Description:
Here's your chance to join a start-up during an exciting early stage as we aspire to dominate the way global businesses make agreements.
Pactum is an AI system that automatically performs commercial negotiations on a massive scale. It helps make the best deals between our clients and their vendors, creating value out of thin air. Our clients are Fortune 500 companies and we build things that matter (we already work with the world's largest company, Walmart – read more from Forbes –, as well as Maersk, Wesco, and many more).
If you want to be a part of this revolutionary opportunity and work with the largest enterprises in the world, then look no further.
Head of Finance:

Title: Business Intelligence Developer | Power Platform (Remote)
Job_Description:
We are seeking an Application Engineer. In this role, you will be responsible for partnering with sales and manufacturers to provide technical expertise regarding applications of products/services. You will answer questions and demonstrate how product offerings and services can solve customer problems and create sales opportunities to promote and reinforce the business image as a total solutions provider. You will quote and manage orders for equipment and services sold for key manufacturers.
Responsibilities:
Provides technical expertise as a specialist for product solutions to existing vertical customers, Outside and Inside Sales Representatives.
Conducts detailed product demonstrations and supports pre-sale activities.
Targets new retrofit customers and projects utilizing product solutions benefits and contractor/turnkey partnerships.

Title: Business Intelligence Developer | Power Platform (Remote)
Job_Description:
We are seeking a Quality Assurance (QA) Engineer with experience in mechanical quality inspection. You will perform inspections and set quality assurance testing models for analysis of raw materials, materials in process, and finished products. You will support Operations to meet all customer requirements, product specifications, and process improvement actions. You will identify Key Performance Indicators (KPIs) for product quality and prepare and present reports on findings to stakeholders.
Responsibilities
Monitor and address the compliance of customer specifications and product specifications.
Develop procedures to solve standard material and product quality issues.
Develop and plan material, product and system tests.

Title: Business Intelligence Developer | Power Platform (Remote)
Job_Description:
We are seeing a Project Engineer who is an independent, self-starter with 3-5 years of experience to drive process improvement, product testing, data collection and analysis.
Responsibilities:
Manage and lead lab technicians, product tear-down and qualitative testing activities.
Oversee lab data collection and routing to value engineering team for cost analysis.
Gather and present cost analysis findings to key business stakeholders such as Sourcing, Category Management and Engineering.
Provide status updates to Engineering and management on ongoing lab activities, timelines, deliverables, challenges and resources needed to meet business deadlines and project goals.

Title: Business Intelligence Developer | Power Platform (Remote)
Job_Description:
The Manufacturing Engineer will drive process improvement and perform product testing, shop floor trouble shooting, data collection and analysis.
Responsibilities:
Develop tooling, fixtures, and test equipment for use in the production and testing.
Develop custom Excel and/or Database programs to assist with both shop floor tasks as well as office administrative activities.
Maintain & Perform Calibration on existing off the shelf and custom test equipment. Interact with outside suppliers where calibration capability does not exist in-house.
Represent Manufacturing throughout the NPI process. Transfer products from design to full production.

Title: Business Intelligence Developer | Power Platform (Remote)
Job_Description:
We are seeking an Associate Electrical Engineer. In this role, you will be responsible for assisting with the design, development, and testing of electrical equipment, components, or systems. You will need to be familiar with mathematical and engineering principles and methods used to design electrical systems. You will be guide and provide support to more experienced engineers. You will collaborate in the integration, testing, commissioning, maintenance and repairing electrical equipment, components, or systems. You will work directly with a team of engineers to deliver electrical solutions.
Responsibilities:
Reviews drawings and visualizes steps required to ensemble, test, commissioning, and maintenance and repair product.
Performs technical duties on assigned projects

Title: Business Intelligence Developer | Power Platform (Remote)
Job_Description:
Accountability and Scope

The Q. A. Engineer-II is accountable for ensuring the validation and corrective actions of non-conforming manufactured aircraft hardware, bearings, electrical products and product documentation and those corrective measures meet acceptable industry reliability standards and regulations, in accordance with Wesco Q.A. Work Instructions.

The Engineer may perform a dimensional evaluation and/or initiates a series of technical evaluation tests. The Engineer interacts with Wesco sales representatives, customers, suppliers, and outside laboratories, if necessary, to collaborate and determine the corrective actions necessary to achieve the best solution for meeting customer requirements. The Engineer monitors, notifies, records and updates Wesco sales representatives, suppliers, customers, and quality data management systems of the corrections initiated and release of pending orders in process.

Individual is responsible for the management of all regulatory product compliance requests for REACH, RoHS, WEEE, Proposition 65, Conflict Minerals and other such product regulations.
Management and coordination of the organization CRMT- conflict minerals reporting.
Provide guidance within regulatory affairs, product engineering, technical publications and operations.

Title: Senior Technical Sales Specialist - Switchgear (7566)
Job_Description:
The Senior Technical Sales Specialist is a customer facing role involved in the commercial/technical decision-making process of the sales cycle with a focus on identifying/closing large projects and driving incremental specialized product growth at all levels. Provides pre and post-sales support and expertise in a specified product category to assist the sales team in their sales efforts of technical products, systems and services. Possesses specialized product knowledge. Will deliver presentations and product demonstrations to customers and sales representatives. Will have a continuing role in customer support to address customer issues in the usage of the products. Executes business plans and assists in creation of plans.
Calls on client, management and representatives, to convince them of desirability of technical products or services offered.
Provides technical services to clients relating to specified products.
Makes sales contacts, researches customer needs and develops product and application information, demonstrating technology solutions for customers.

Title: Senior Technical Sales Specialist - Switchgear (7566)
Job_Description:
As an Industrial Automation Specialist, you will be responsible for providing pre or post-sales support/expertise to assist the sales team in their sales efforts of industrial automation products, systems and services. You will possess specialized product knowledge. You may deliver presentations and product demonstrations to customers and sales representatives. You may have a continuing role in customer support to address customer issues in the usage of the products. You will utilize LAN/WAN/Wireless network monitoring tools to ensure optimal system utilization, performance and system availability. Supports vendors to install, maintain, and troubleshoot systems and services vital to organization's business. Contributes to highly complex technical projects.
Responsibilities:
Configure, install and maintain network Switches, Routers and Security Hardware.

Title: Senior Technical Sales Specialist - Switchgear (7566)
Job_Description:
We are seeking a Senior Technical Sales Specialist. In this role, you will be in a customer facing role involved in the commercial/technical decision-making process of the sales cycle with a focus on identifying/closing large projects and driving incremental specialized product growth at all levels. You will provide pre and post-sales support and expertise in a specified product category to assist the sales team in their sales efforts of technical products, systems and services. You will possess a specialized product knowledge. You will deliver presentations and product demonstrations to customers and sales representatives. Responsibilities:
Calls on client, management and representatives, to convince them of desirability of technical products or services offered.

Title: Senior Technical Sales Specialist - Switchgear (7566)
Job_Description:
We are seeking a Senior Quotations Specialist. In this role, you will develop proposals, bids, quotations, or other documents describing organizational products and services in response to requests from prospective clients. You will collaborate with members of the sales, marketing, finance, legal, or product teams to ensure content is complete, accurate, and timely. You may be responsible for developing responses to the most complex or high-value inquiries.
Responsibilities:
Identifies potential projects for bid and compiles list of material requirements including, supplies, lighting, switchgear, and other distribution apparatuses.
Interacts with consultants representing customers to obtain approvals for bidding.
Reads and interprets specifications and blueprints.

Title: Senior Technical Sales Specialist - Switchgear (7566)
Job_Description:
As the Associate Planner, you will support the functional Subject Matter Expert (SME) and focal point for the planning process in Demand Planning and/or Supply Planning related tasks. You will assist in analysis to lead and inform cross-functional decisions related to tracking key performance indicators and inputs into supply chain decisions. This is a hybrid role which requires two days in office, three days remote.
Responsibilities:
Support Demand and/or Supply Planning processes.
Assist in gathering required inputs to measure and improve forecast accuracy metrics.
Provide assistance in conducting operational reviews with key business leaders in Commercial, Category Management, Sourcing, and Inventory to serve as Demand and/or Supply inputs for Sales & Operations Execution (S&OE).

Title: Senior Technical Sales Specialist - Switchgear (7566)
Job_Description:
We are seeking a Senior Outside Sales Representative. In this role, you will be responsible for developing new prospects and interacting with assigned customers to increase sales and margin of the company's products and/or services. You will participate in customer business planning to understand customer needs. Your primary focus is on face-to-face selling and account management activities to meet sales revenue goals by assessing customer needs and suggesting appropriate products, services and/or solutions and ensure a smooth sales process. A wide degree of creativity and latitude is required. You will engage with all levels of the customer’s organization including technical, operations, supply chain and executive management. Ypu may develop and deliver sales bids, presentations, proposals and/or product demonstrations.
Responsibilities:
Qualifies accounts by determining market potential and provides periodic territory sales forecasts.

Title: Analyst - Sourcing (Hybrid)
Job_Description:
As an Analyst - Sourcing, you will be responsible for researching, analyzing and evaluating marketplace data of vendors, manufacturers and suppliers and in providing business appropriate recommendations based on this analysis. You will manage a supply chain for goods or materials that ensure high material availability at the lowest possible total ownership cost to client operations. You will act as the primary contact to current and potential outside suppliers. You will manage the supply chain processes for a given commodity, including the development of inventory strategy, such that its effectiveness/efficiency is continually improved.
Responsibilities:
Negotiates contract elements, including terms and conditions, pricing, and lead-time.
Manages suppliers’ performance, including support, development and monitoring of supplier performance metrics.
Negotiates expected supplier performance metrics and develops and administers corrective action plans for performance failures.

Title: Director - Data Science
Job_Description:
As the Director - Data Science, you will direct activities related to the strategy, design, development, and implementation of Data Science, Artificial Intelligence (AI) and Machine Learning (ML) deliveries for enterprise application functions. You will frequently interact with C-Level leaders, lead and create new Machine Learning Operations (MLOPs) and data science capabilities. You will manage multiple Data Scientist teams, supporting different products or lines of businesses to build innovations around AI.
Responsibilities:
Create strategies and objectives for the sub-function and develop budgets, policies, and procedures to support the organization
Direct and guide managers, and review different AI/ML modelling requests, timeline, and cost

Title: Director - Data Science
Job_Description:
Overview:
IDC is seeking a Research Vice President (RVP) covering Storage, Converged, Hyperconverged and Composable Infrastructure. Reporting to the GVP/GM for the Infrastructure Systems, Platforms and Technologies and Buyer View Group, the RVP will be a key face of IDC’s market intelligence and advisory services on Enterprise IT and Cloud Infrastructure. We are looking for candidates with the experience and skills needed to help IDC’s clients bring innovative infrastructure products and services to market. The RVP will have a broad and in-depth knowledge of the enterprise IT and cloud infrastructure industry with a specific focus on Systems, Platforms and Technologies, Vendor landscape, and Use cases and workloads.

A successful RVP will become an important member within a team of industry experts and will be looked upon as a frequent contributor to IDC’s enterprise and cloud IT infrastructure services research.



Responsibilities:
Qualifications:

Title: Director - Data Science
Job_Description:
Overview:
IDC is seeking a Research Manager who will be responsible for covering the ongoing trends, opportunities, and competitive landscape in the Unified Communications & Collaboration (UC&C) market. IDC's Worldwide Unified Communications team within the Network and Telecommunications Group is looking for an individual who is deeply knowledgeable on the UC&C market. Knowledge of UC&C technologies and strategies should include familiarity of current trends, major providers in the hardware, software and as-a-service subsegments of the UC&C market, including on-prem and cloud-based solutions, as well as be familiar with the role that UCaaS Service providers play in this segment.

This position carries the expectation the individual will author a mix of shorter industry-event reactive pieces as well as lengthier market trend and thought leadership documents that provide deeper insight into the changing nature of the market. The ability to build relationships with vendors and to reach out to industry representatives proactively is critical. This position will possibly support forecasts and quantitative deliverables in the future.

Qualifications:

Title: Director - Data Science
Job_Description:
Overview:
IDC is seeking a Research Manager with experience in financial management software and/or financial management operations to join the IDC team to conduct primary research, engage in quantitative research management, client engagement and business development. The Research Manager will establish and maintain a strong industry presence as a financial management software thought leader, including working with the general business and technology trade press. It is essential for the Research Manager to bring an innovative and creative perspective on the role technology is playing in the constantly changing financial software markets.

Why IDC?

IDC is the most respected global technology market research firm. We are changing the way the world thinks about the impact of technology on business and society. Our people, data, and analytics create global technology insights that accelerate customer success.

Qualifications:

Title: Director - Data Science
Job_Description:
Overview:
IDC is seeking a Research Vice President, Communications Service Provider Operations for our Worldwide Network and Telecommunications group. The dynamic individual, being knowledgeable about IT operations in the Telecom and Communications SP segment, will be responsible for the market research agenda and consulting as it relates to ongoing technology and digital transformation amongst service providers. Domain knowledge of OSS/BSS, service assurance, fulfillment, orchestration and monetization domains especially as they relate to the ongoing telecom operations transformation initiatives is a key requirement for this position.

Digital transformation and a rapidly changing competitive landscape is motivating service providers to evolve faster than ever before, while embracing many of the learnings from cloud and network virtualization, including the ability to leverage open source across the infrastructure stack. Providing thought leadership around these industry shifts, what these mean to operators and vendors, and substantiating with quantitative and qualitative analysis is a key to the success of this position.



Responsibilities:
Qualifications:

Title: Director - Data Science
Job_Description:
Overview:
IDC is seeking a Research Manager to join our CMO Advisory practice. This is an opportunity for an experienced analyst or practitioner turned analyst, to help contribute and grow our CMO Advisory practice. The Research Manager is responsible for contributing to our syndicated research, building relationships with our strategic clients, and providing domain expertise of B2B marketing practices and operations.

The CMO Advisory practice focuses on helping companies achieve their business goals through a better connection with today's empowered customer and the application of management science to the transforming marketing function. The research agenda includes both quantitative and qualitative studies including an annual benchmark of B2B marketing spending, deeper dives into specific topics (i.e. Future of B2B Marketing, Event Marketing in COVID's wake), and an annual B2B Tech Buyer behavior and preference study.

The Research Director will establish and maintain a strong presence within the technology and services spending areas around the Office of the CFOs buying preferences for the organization overall. This Research Director thought leader will look at the evolving dynamics of the Office of the CFO as it relates towards the future of the digital enterprise including technology and services objectives, priorities, programs, and investments. This individual should also be familiar with Governance, Risk, and Compliance (GRC) as it pertains to the Office of the CFO. This individual will also work closely with the general business and technology trade press. It is essential for the Research Director to bring an innovative and creative perspective on the role technology and services are playing in the constantly evolving Office of the CFO.

Job_Description:

In this role, you will develop proposals, bids, quotations, or other documents describing organizational products and services in response to requests from prospective clients. You will collaborate with members of the sales, marketing, finance, legal, or product teams to ensure content is complete, accurate, and timely.
Responsibilities:
Identifies potential projects for bid and compiles list of material requirements including, supplies, lighting, switchgear, and other distribution apparatuses.
Reads and interprets specifications and blueprints.
Communicates with suppliers to discuss material specifications, clarifies and confirms bill of materials, negotiates pricing and identifies alternatives for special or custom orders.

Title: Quotations Specialist - Lighting/ Switchgear
Job_Description:
Hours - Monday - Friday 8:00 am - 4:30 pm
Field Inventory Technician
Why You’ll Love Wesco
When you join Wesco, you become part of a global leader in business-to-business distribution, logistics services and supply chain management solutions. With our best-in-class product and services portfolio and our massive scale, there are endless opportunities for you to build your career with us.
A Day in The Life of a Field Inventory Technician
As a Field Inventory Technician, you will be responsible for traveling through assigned areas to call on accounts. You will check inventory and note quantity of items for delivery to each account to ensure proper product inventory is maintained.

Title: Quotations Specialist - Lighting/ Switchgear
Job_Description:
Wesco Group is looking for an experienced and talented Accounts Receivable specialist to join our accounting team. A basic understanding of accounting, standard accounts receivables procedures, processing payments, and a positive attitude is essential. The ideal candidate would be looking for stability and have a willingness to learn and grow as Wesco continues to expand.
Accounts Receivable Specialist Responsibilities:
Processing and distribution of invoices to customers
Reconcile and resolve customer accounts and review any discrepancies
Application of receipts to appropriate account/invoice
Preparing and processing of daily deposits
Monitor customer account details for non-payments or delayed payments

Title: Quotations Specialist - Lighting/ Switchgear
Job_Description:
Lease - Qualifications/Responsibilities
Manage and negotiate commercial lease renewals, 130+ locations throughout the company
o Research comps to ensure rates are competitive as part of renewal process
o Assess buildings and location needs to are met to maximize operational efficiency and cost effectiveness
Track Rental rates and NNN’s
o Work with accounting to ensure proper amounts are paid each month
o Perform occupancy cost review/audits to ensure NNN compliance

Title: Quotations Specialist - Lighting/ Switchgear
Job_Description:
Wesco Group is looking for an Accounts Payable Specialist to join our team. This individual would have a basic understanding of accounting, and standard payable procedures. The ideal candidate would be looking for stability and have a willingness to learn and grow as Wesco continues to expand.
Accounts Payable Specialist Responsibilities:
Ability to process large number of invoices daily.
Review and process bills for multiple Wesco locations
Process employee expense reports and reimbursements
Strong ability to meet payment deadlines.
Ability to problem solve and analyze invoices and journal entries

Title: Quotations Specialist - Lighting/ Switchgear
Job_Description:
We are seeking a Credit and Collections Analyst. In this role, you will be responsible for, working under direct supervision, collects and maintains basic credit information. You will assist in review and verification of overdue accounts. You will contact costumers to confirm outstanding payments and renews credit information to help minimize outstanding debts.
Responsibilities:
Monitors past due invoices and make a high-volume of collections contacts via phone, e-mail, or customer portals.
Works with the customer to determine root cause of dispute for unpaid or short-paid invoices. Identifies and documents detailed reason.
Performs customer account reconciliations, including research of unapplied cash, and credits and unearned discounts.

Title: Quotations Specialist - Lighting/ Switchgear
Job_Description:
We are seeking a Credit and Collections Coordinator. In this role you will support the Financial Services Team and is responsible for various duties that may include processing customer CHAX payments, entering customer invoices into third-party or customer portals, establishing new customer accounts, and performing other routine tasks as required. You will work with confidential and sensitive information. You will require making some independent decisions regarding planning, organizing, and scheduling work.
Responsibilities:
CHAX Payment Processing
Maintain and enter customer CHAX payments for approved customers.
Follow a defined process for CHAX processing and follow-up on any declined/ CHAX cards or other issues.

Title: Quotations Specialist - Lighting/ Switchgear

In this role, you will report to the Business Intelligence Manager who is responsible for tools and technology supporting the company’s profitability initiative. You will be responsible for creating Power BI reporting and design, PowerApps applications, SQL table design, automation tooling, and possibly machine learning models.
Responsibilities:
Develop and maintain PowerApps for the business
Develop and maintain new and existing Power BI reporting
Work with SQL databases to create new tables and views, along with querying existing data

Title: Quotations Specialist - Lighting/ Switchgear
Job_Description:
Data Entry/Clerical Position
Wesco Mfg based in Deer Park NY is a well-established company that has been in business for over 30 years. We have almost no job turnover and all of our employees have been with us long term. We are looking to fill an important position of someone relocating. This relocation is several months out and full on the job training is available during this transition for someone eager to learn. This is an important support position which requires extreme accuracy and attention to detail. Job duties include data entry, filing, internet/computer proficiency and working with our in-house software Pentagon2000. Candidate should be punctual, reliable and consistent as well as dependable and quality oriented.
We are offering a competitive salary and generous benefits. This is a unique opportunity for a talented, motivated individual to excel and thrive in a challenging environment. Candidate should take pride in personal performance and be willing to work hard as there is limited downtime during the day. This is a fast paced busy office. Email resumes for consideration.

Title: Quotations Specialist - Lighting/ Switchgear
Job_Description:
Under general supervision, provides human resources guidance to assigned business groups, including employee relations, recruiting and staffing, performance management, diversity, conflict resolution, training, and process coordination. Consults with management on strategic and operational HR and business issues.
Counsels managers and supervisors regarding employee relations issues and recommends actions consistent with policy.
Counsels and advises management and employees on problem resolution, supervisory discretion and policy interpretation.
Advises and assists managers to ensure consistent application and compliance with HR programs, policies and initiatives.
Assists in development of project plans and executes plans to enhance staff development, engagement and retention.

Title: Quotations Specialist - Lighting/ Switchgear
Job_Description:
You will manage and oversee all aspects of a project to ensure it is completed on-time and within budget. You will have overall responsibility for managing scope, cost, schedule, internal staffing and outside vendors. You will prepare reports for upper management regarding status of project. You will work on projects/matters of limited complexity in a support role. Work is closely managed.
Responsibilities:
Provides support with project development from beginning to end
Assists in defining project scope, goals and deliverables to support business goals in collaboration with senior management and stakeholders
Assists in developing full-scale project plans and associated communications documents

Title: Quotations Specialist - Lighting/ Switchgear
Job_Description:
We are seeking a Lead Program Manager. In this role, you will be responsible for two or more Customer Programs consisting of customer support services, purchasing, warehouse management and other contract compliance activities with respective customers. You will also work closely with Wesco Outside Sales Representatives, field sales managers, and sales leaders.
Responsibilities:
Coordinates activities in accordance company policies, and if applicable, customer policies, procedures and principles.
Coordinates technical support and training needs.
Confers with customers on programs performance and evaluates areas for improvement and expanded services.
Administers on-site human resource activities.

Title: Quotations Specialist - Lighting/ Switchgear
Job_Description:
We are seeking a Senior Credit and Collections Analyst. In this role, you will be responsible for collecting and maintaining accurate credit information. You will review and verify overdue accounts. You will contact customers to confirm outstanding payments and renews credit information to help minimize outstanding debts. You will mentor others in lower level roles in Financial Services.
Responsibilities:
Works with customer accounts payable staff to determine payment and invoice discrepancies.
Monitors past due invoices and make collections calls.
Prepares and transmits credit reference inquires for filing with credit applications.

Title: Quotations Specialist - Lighting/ Switchgear
Job_Description:
WESCO Global Intelligent Automation COE is looking for an experienced UiPath developer to implement the automation pipeline. As Senior Developer, you will own and perform end to end development from solution design to implementation, user acceptance, and production monitoring. You will also be guiding and assisting citizen developers with design and/or implementation of the more challenging parts of their automations. Additionally, you will be responsible for executing, driving, and owning assignments through all stages of the development lifecycle to completion.
Responsibilities
Works directly with SME, as well as with project managers, and business analysts to translate business requirements and technical specifications to actual automations.
Maintains a culture of open communication, collaboration, mutual respect and productive behaviors.

Title: Quotations Specialist - Lighting/ Switchgear
Job_Description:
As an Operations Supervisor you will oversee operations including receiving, picking, packing, shipping, wire cutting, light assembly as well as housekeeping of the warehouse. You will plan, direct, and coordinate the storage and distribution operations of products and materials as well as manage designated areas of Warehouse Operation, oversee functional areas, and perform manager’s duties as assigned. You are responsible for consistent application of SOPs (Standard Operating Policies) and associate administration in the facility.
Responsibilities:
Ensures compliance with operating procedures for receiving, handling, storing, and shipping of products and materials
Ensures a safe working environment for all associates including surveying facility for repair and maintenance items, promoting and managing safety programs; ensuring policy adherence for worker’s compensation and general liability issues

Title: Quotations Specialist - Lighting/ Switchgear
Job_Description:
This position will manage the organization’s regulatory product compliance program. This will involve working with sales, marketing, customers and vendors to complete and track incoming requests, gathering significant amount of data, data entry and reporting required information to customers in a timely manner.
Responsibilities
Individual is responsible for the management of all regulatory product compliance requests for REACH, RoHS, WEEE, Proposition 65, Conflict Minerals and other such product regulations.
Management and coordination of the organization CRMT- conflict minerals reporting.
Provide guidance within regulatory affairs, product engineering, technical publications and operations.

Title: Quotations Specialist - Lighting/ Switchgear
Job_Description:
In this role you will be responsible for managing large sales and performance datasets specific to Sourcing, Catalog, Supplier, Inventory and Project Management. You will be responsible for providing analytical support to sales leaders and supplier relations team throughout the assigned Business Unit(s).
Responsibilities:
Compile and analyze data on historical sales and trends to forecast future trends.
Build compelling, interactive, and actionable reporting on top of structured data models that helps in deriving meaningful business insights from large and complex datasets.
Gather requirements and design performance reports and forecasting reports in Power BI for the assigned business units.
Gather, publish, and maintain information related to historical, current, and future sales performance.

Title: Quotations Specialist - Lighting/ Switchgear
Job_Description:
We are seeking an Application Engineer. In this role, you will be responsible for partnering with sales and manufacturers to provide technical expertise regarding applications of products/services. You will answer questions and demonstrate how product offerings and services can solve customer problems and create sales opportunities to promote and reinforce the business image as a total solutions provider. You will quote and manage orders for equipment and services sold for key manufacturers.
Responsibilities:
Provides technical expertise as a specialist for product solutions to existing vertical customers, Outside and Inside Sales Representatives.
Conducts detailed product demonstrations and supports pre-sale activities.
Targets new retrofit customers and projects utilizing product solutions benefits and contractor/turnkey partnerships.

Title: Quotations Specialist - Lighting/ Switchgear
Job_Description:
Short Description for Internal Candidates
As a Site Manager I, you will provide customer and purchasing support, inventory control, and other contract compliance activities through subordinates. You will address complaints and resolve problems, establish and maintain an environment of continuous improvement and cost savings initiatives. You will be accountable for identifying areas of opportunity to increase sales and billing margins. You will be responsible for managing employees onsite and lead a team of up to 6 employees. You will also be responsible for a site spend of up to $10M, for cost savings initiatives up to 2% and provide support to 1-3 cribs.
Description for Internal Candidates

Title: Quotations Specialist - Lighting/ Switchgear
Job_Description:
Accountability and Scope
The Internal Operations System Administrator II is responsible for processing frequency based reports as assigned for management to support up to date progress on functional/department performance. The Adminsitrator II will partner with various subject matter experts to review reporting data to ensure the integrity of the information is accurate and concise. Additionally, the Administrator will compile the raw data into meaningful ways to present information to the business and respond to internal customer inquiries around statuses, etc.

Essential Duties and Responsibilities
Maintains a positive image of the company with internal customers, while demonstrating high standards of business ethics and integrity.

Title: Quotations Specialist - Lighting/ Switchgear
Job_Description:
As a Planner - Supplier Material, you will be responsible for all Inventory Forecasting activities associated with customers and products. You will create and maintain forecast models for their respective business units, incorporating business intelligence and forecast information gathered from Sales, Category Management, Suppliers, Operations and Suppliers. You will act as the integration point into the Sales and Commercial organization. You will be responsible to build, maintain, and evolve demand and supply models leveraging advanced a suite of planning applications. You will lead the dialogue cadence for their respective customers and products with key counterparts in Sales, Category Management, Operations and other business partners. Your objective will be to balance Service, Cost and Working Capital.
Responsibilities:
Maintains a constant relationship with the sales, category management, finance, sourcing and operations teams to lead and influence standard planning process, including maintenance of demand forecasting drivers. Influence and communicate inventory strategies and trade-offs (Service, Cost, Working Capital) to business partners and lead optimization efforts

Title: Quotations Specialist - Lighting/ Switchgear
Job_Description:
We are seeking a Credit and Collections Supervisor. In this role, you will be responsible for the activities and operations in the credit and collections department. You will oversee the processing and verification of applications for credit and the solicitation for payment on overdue accounts. You will investigate credit issues and suggests payment options to be approved. You will ensure collectors follow all protocols, laws and regulations to collect payments efficiently. You will supervise a small group of para-professional staff in an organization characterized by highly transactional or repetitive processes. You will contribute to the development of processes and procedures.
Responsibilities:
Selects, manages, evaluates and develops staff. Challenges employees, builds effective teams, and provides staff with coaching and feedback.

Title: Quotations Specialist - Lighting/ Switchgear
Job_Description:
As a Manager - Digital Product, you will oversee the entire lifecycle of a digital product, from inception to maturity. You will be responsible for the overall vision of the product in alignment with business objectives and managing the role out of this vision into a successful launch. You will act as a mediator between the consumers and the technical teams, communicating consumer needs and translating those needs into new product features for the team to design and build. You will understand product methodologies and can independently operate to execute on improvements and promote value. You will play a key role in recommending a digital roadmap to help execute strategic and customer experience goals.
Responsibilities:
Drives product strategies and vision to build best in class digital products.
Accountable for the success of the product and ensures that the products deliver measurable value across the Product Management Lifecycle

Title: Quotations Specialist - Lighting/ Switchgear
Job_Description:
As a Supervisor - Field, you will lead, direct, and execute the day-to-day operational objectives of one or more service technicians. You will manage projects, help coordinate team activities, identify appropriate resources needed, and develop schedules to ensure timely completion of projects in accordance with the customer contract. You must be skilled in heavy equipment operation for field working. You must be must be geographically mobile.
Responsibilities:
Directs and manages project development from beginning to end according to the customer contract.
Provides daily direction to Field Service Supervisors to ensure timely completion of projects.
Liaises with project stakeholders on an ongoing basis. Directs customer interaction.

You will support Operations to meet all customer requirements, product specifications, and process improvement actions. You will identify Key Performance Indicators (KPIs) for product quality and prepare and present reports on findings to stakeholders.
Responsibilities
Monitor and address the compliance of customer specifications and product specifications.
Develop procedures to solve standard material and product quality issues.
Develop and plan material, product and system tests.

Title: Quotations Specialist - Lighting/ Switchgear
Job_Description:
We are seeing a Project Engineer who is an independent, self-starter with 3-5 years of experience to drive process improvement, product testing, data collection and analysis.
Responsibilities:
Manage and lead lab technicians, product tear-down and qualitative testing activities.
Oversee lab data collection and routing to value engineering team for cost analysis.
Gather and present cost analysis findings to key business stakeholders such as Sourcing, Category Management and Engineering.
Provide status updates to Engineering and management on ongoing lab activities, timelines, deliverables, challenges and resources needed to meet business deadlines and project goals.

You will investigate credit issues and suggest payment options to be approved.
Responsibilities:
Monitors past due invoices and makes collections contacts via phone, e-mail, or customer portals.
Evaluates collectability of unearned cash discounts, finance charges, small dollar invoices, etc. and performs and approves write-offs of uncollectable amounts within their level of authority.
Participates in and/or leads monthly accounts receivable aging and dispute reviews with financial services team and branch personnel. Documents and pursue follow-up actions agreed to during meetings.

Title: Analyst - Credit and Collections (Remote)
Job_Description:
As the Lead Analyst - IT Support, you will coordinate and facilitate the day-to-day operations associated with production datacenters. You will oversee the receipt, staging, installation, and disposal of computing hardware and networking. While ensuring the physical security of company assets and maintaining the environmental integrity of the space, you will also work with building management and equipment vendors to plan, schedule, and execute maintenance and repairs. You will also be responsible for responding to emergency situations and offers Project Management support globally.
Responsibilities:
Conduct frequent datacenter walkthroughs to verify the proper operation of security access, AC units, electrical generator, and 480V UPS.
Monitor and maintain overall cleanliness and removal of fire and safety hazards.

Title: Analyst - Credit and Collections (Remote)
Job_Description:
We are seeking an Accounts Payable Analyst. In this role, you will perform support tasks and activities in the accounts payable function. You will validate supplier invoices to system purchase orders to make sure our suppliers are paid timely. You will perform a match between the supplier invoice and system generated PO, ensuring that all approvals are given and procedures are followed. You will maintain invoice and other transaction records and works directly with vendors and internal personnel on statements, past due balances and discrepancies.
Responsibilities:
Compiles invoices owed by the company to suppliers or other organizations.
Verifies purchase order detail, interprets Levels of Authority and processes invoices.
Maintains all invoice and other transaction records.

Title: Analyst - Credit and Collections (Remote)
Job_Description:
As the Change Management Analyst, you will provide practical, hands-on organizational change management support for business process and technology projects across Wesco’s global business functions. By leveraging globally standard change management process and tools, you will participate in a number of change management tactics such as planning and executing communications, stakeholder management, readiness assessments and surveys, organizational impact assessments and transition planning, and other change management related work. You will fill a variety of change management execution needs within a project team or across several projects, based on the priorities and needs of the Change Management Office (CMO). You will provide change management support and leadership for large global M&A, transformation programs, or smaller functional projects the CMO supports.
Responsibilities:
Supports the execution of organizational change management plans by change managers and business leaders.

Title: Analyst - Credit and Collections (Remote)
Job_Description:
As an Analyst - Sourcing, you will be responsible for researching, analyzing and evaluating marketplace data of vendors, manufacturers and suppliers and in providing business appropriate recommendations based on this analysis. You will manage a supply chain for goods or materials that ensure high material availability at the lowest possible total ownership cost to client operations. You will act as the primary contact to current and potential outside suppliers. You will manage the supply chain processes for a given commodity, including the development of inventory strategy, such that its effectiveness/efficiency is continually improved.
Responsibilities:
Negotiates contract elements, including terms and conditions, pricing, and lead-time.
Manages suppliers’ performance, including support, development and monitoring of supplier performance metrics.
Negotiates expected supplier performance metrics and develops and administers corrective action plans for performance failures.

Title: Analyst - Credit and Collections (Remote)
Job_Description:
This person is responsible for, working under direct supervision, collects and maintains basic credit information. Assists in review and verification of overdue accounts. Contacts costumers to confirm outstanding payments and renews credit information to help minimize outstanding debts. Requires a high school diploma or its equivalent. Works under moderate supervision. Typically requires 1- 3 years of related experience.
Responsibilities:
Monitors past due invoices and make a high-volume of collections contacts via phone, e-mail, or customer portals.
Works with the customer to determine root cause of dispute for unpaid or short-paid invoices. Identifies and documents detailed reason.
Performs customer account reconciliations, including research of unapplied cash, and credits and unearned discounts.

Title: Analyst - Credit and Collections (Remote)
Job_Description:
We are seeking an Associate Analyst - Pricing. In this role, you will be responsible for customer price and cost loading activities, customer classification, report generation and customer incentive calculations. You will interact with pricing, purchasing and branch personnel. You will ensure data accuracy and integrity.
Responsibilities:
Loads and maintains of supplier special cost authorizations, customer sell-side price agreements, and standard cost agreements.
Reviews existing price and cost agreements and initiates updates.
Maintains knowledge and awareness of upcoming supplier cost charges.
Applies customer sell-side price adjustments to prevent margin erosion.

Title: Analyst - Credit and Collections (Remote)
Job_Description:
As a Senior Sourcing Analyst, you will be responsible for leading implementation of new supply chain initiatives, contract administration, and negotiation of specific strategic commodity categories. You will collaborate with supply chain director during new business implementation and existing business expansion. You will act and serve as primary contact to current and potential outside suppliers and manages supply chain processes, including development of inventory strategy, including effective and efficient continuous improvement.
RESPONSIBILITIES:
Independently negotiates contract elements, including terms and conditions, pricing, and lead-time.
Manages suppliers’ performance, including support, development and monitoring of supplier performance metrics.

Title: Analyst - Credit and Collections (Remote)
Job_Description:
As a Senior Analyst - Business Systems you will be responsible for deploying and supporting business applications and providing guidance to business analysts . You will oversee select modules within the assigned functional track with accountability for all levels of the system development lifecycle including design, implementation, cutover, and support for the select modules.
Responsibilities:
Consulting and assisting in the implementation, development, system design, conversion and support for applicable business systems.
Formulates and defines systems scope and objectives through research and fact-finding combined with an understanding of applicable business systems and industry requirements.

Title: Analyst - Credit and Collections (Remote)
Job_Description:
As an Analyst - Sales Operations, you will be responsible for managing large sales and performance datasets specific to Sourcing, Catalog, Supplier, Inventory and Project Management. You will be responsible for providing analytical support to sales leaders throughout the assigned Business Unit(s).
Responsibilities:
Compile and analyze data on historical sales and trends to forecast future trends.
Build compelling, interactive, and actionable reporting on top of structured data models that helps in deriving meaningful business insights from large and complex datasets.
Gather requirements and design performance reports and forecasting reports for the Global Sales teams.
Gather, publish, and maintain information related to historical, current, and future sales performance.

Title: Analyst - Credit and Collections (Remote)
Job_Description:
As an Analyst - Transportation, you will be responsible for providing analytical support for transportation programs including small package, LTL, dedicated, international, courier, truckload, rail or expedited. You will also be responsible for supporting government regulatory agencies, freight audit and payment, and supply chain analytics.
Responsibilities:
Subject Matter Expert for handling orders for export.
Assist to develop, negotiate, and administer national programs for specific modes, including small package, LTL, private fleet, dedicated, international, courier, truckload, rail and expedited.
Provide customer service to internal and external customer inquiries.
Analyze and improve mode-specific service and expense metrics.

Title: Analyst - Credit and Collections (Remote)
Job_Description:
As an Operations Senior Systems Analyst you will be responsible for deploying and supporting Operations business applications. You will oversee planning, testing, training, and troubleshooting lifecycle process for the Warehouse Management Systems (WMS).
Responsibilities:
Partner with Operations teams to uncover Warehouse Management System (WMS) business needs and liaison with IT or other groups to strategize and design system and process solutions.
Perform needs analysis and then plan the system and process flows according to business rules and operational needs.
Identify system and process issues to make viable options for productivity and accuracy. Write standard operating procedures for business documentation.

Title: Analyst - Credit and Collections (Remote)
Job_Description:
As an Analyst - Inventory, your primary focus will be on inventory analysis. You will execute strategies and processes to ensure that inventory and service levels are optimized.
Responsibilities:
Executes accurate, scheduled daily, weekly, and monthly reports.
Reconciles report data to ensure data integrity.
Audits processing errors or bad data points before releasing reports.
Maintains report contact database, controls user access to shared network drives and other common resources, and executes regular backups.
Maintains production reports, makes approved changes to report data by modifying Teradata SQL, formatting Excel macros, and Access databases.

Title: Analyst - Credit and Collections (Remote)
Job_Description:
This person is responsible for the preparation, coordination, and documentation of forward-looking financial and business-related projects. Prepares financial forecasts and/or reports and provides strategic analytical expertise for assigned areas. Identifies issues and suggests courses of action and makes recommendations for improving operations
Responsibilities:
Develops and manages profitability analysis across multiple lines of business.
Enhances and maintains standardized approaches in analyzing, evaluating, and obtaining approvals for financial support of RFP’s, bids, and proposed contracts.
Evaluates actual performance on contracts vs. proposed.
Coordinates across functions and business units to obtain information and garner input on key assumptions and variables.

Title: Analyst - Credit and Collections (Remote)
Job_Description:
As the Master Data Analyst you will be responsible for maintaining data integrity for existing customer data, interpreting data into standardized Wesco data framework, and performing data quality checks. You will develop and manage business relationships with project team members and senior leaders across the organization. In addition, you are responsible for driving performance improvement through the dissemination of data analysis and reporting, communicating analysis findings, and directing supply chain partners to the correct course of action. You must have an understanding of customer and supply chain partner data sources, and how these data sources can be utilized to improve Wesco performance.
Responsibilities
Perform functions related to the collection, aggregation, consolidation, maintenance, and distribution of data throughout the organization and ensure the integrity of the master data.

Job_Description:

IDG, Inc. is looking for a Senior IT Solutions Business Analyst to join our team!

At IDG, Inc. we are committed to building relationships through trusted content and data. Monitors progress toward objectives.
Provides analyses and recommendations based on financial data and other pertinent information.

Title: Analyst - Credit and Collections (Remote)
Job_Description:
We are seeking a Senior Analyst - HRIS. In this role, you will process and analyze employee information by using Human Resources Information Systems (HRIS). You will design, implement, and analyzes reports to determine the overall trends of the organization. You will ensure systems integration and upgrades by collaborating and communicating with other colleagues.

Acts as liaison between business, human resources director and process owners, and 3rd party development vendor for all HRIS system?s needs.

Responsibilities:
Develop solutions to streamline and automate processes while identifying and addressing technical issues to maximize overall business results for the assigned organization(s).

Job_Description:
As the Warehouse Business Systems Analyst, you will be responsible for deploying and supporting business applications. You will also oversee select applications within modules of assigned functional track, including accountability, system development lifecycle, design, implementation, and cutover.

Formulates and defines systems scope and objectives through research and fact-finding combined with an understanding of applicable business systems and industry requirements.
